37975003.review:
Klasika, kterou každý, kdo se o ní doslechl chtěl - ale bohužel se o téhle hře na přelomu milénia, kdy vyšla, moc nevědělo. 
Hra nabízí naprosto otevřený svět, ve kterém si můžete zvolit cestu řešení příběhu jak chcete. Postavy si na Vás budou utvářet názor podle toho, jak se chováte a jak řešíte questy a podquesty. Jako hráč se ocitnete ve velmi propracovaném světě s funkčním ekosystémem, kde NPC budou chodit a zabývat se svými věcmi, ne jen stát a čekat až k nim přijdete.
Engine hry má své mouchy, ale vývojáři mysleli na důležité věci, jako že při rozhovoru se postavy navzájem dívají do očí. Tahle hra, kdyby měla ve své době lepší marketing jistě by způsobila revoluci větší než Half-Life, jenž vyšel jen o rok dříve, nebo Morrowind který vyšel až o celé tři roky později! Ale co se dá dělat, máme šanci si ji zahrát a i když engine působí místy neohrabaně, postavy jsou uvěřitelné a příjemné, příběh neotřelý a herní mechanismus solidní.
Hru doporučuji pro ty, kdo si chtějí vyzkoušet, jak vypadaly první otevřené světy ve hrách, pro ty co si chtějí zahrát slušnou akční adventuru, nebo pro ty, co se chtějí ponořit do uchvacujícho a do posledních podrobností promyšleného světa!
Pokud se Vám nelíbí grafika, můžete tady na Steamu zkusit Outcast - Second Contact, což by měla být prakticky totožná hra jen s předělanou grafikou. Bohužel engine neprodělal velké změny, takže co jsem slyšel zůstává trochu nemotorný.

37529110.review:
Beginnen wir mal mit der Frage "Wieso hat Outcast (1.1 / Second Contact) einen guten Status unter den Klassikern, bzw. warum die meisten (die 1.0er Gamer auf jeden Fall) so davon schwärmen."

Da ich ein 1.0er Gamer bin, würde ich sagen:
1. Es definierte sozusagen die OpenWorld Games bzw. dieses Gerne (siehe Punkt 2.) und zudem bot es (neben dem Mainquest) nichtlineare Subquests.
2. Obwohl die Paradise Engine (die übrigens auf der Voxel Engine von Novalogic 1992 beruht [Voxel = 3D Pixel]) sich nicht wirklich durchsetzen konnte, konnte man damit (für damalige Verhältnisse) frei begehbare große Welten / Level darstellen. Und eben diese Engine hobt grafisch gesehen das Game vom Rest ab und schafft heute dieses schöne Retro Flair.
3. Die "Dreingaben" damals, es gab Karten (glaube ich zumindest, ist schon ne Weile her) und ein Ulukai T-Shirt zum Game dazu, gefriergetrocknet und gepreßt. Hatte in etwa die Größe eines Puks.

Das ist zumindest meine Meinung bzw. meine Gründe warum Outcast eine Perle ist.

Zum eigentlichen Review;
im Grunde ist das die 1.0 von Outcast die für modernen Rechner / Betriebssysteme gängig gemacht wurde. Look, Sound & Gameplay ist beim (guten) alten geblieben. Man hätte es jedoch um eine Autosave Funktion ergänzen können. Die Mainquest ist spannend und abwechslungsreich, die Subquests bieten auch viel Abwechslung. Im Hinblick auf heutige Games machen diese mehr Spaß, da es eben NICHT 5-6 verschiedene Aufgaben gibt die sich dann zig mal wiederholen.
Der Sound ist nach wie vor erstklassig (Moskauer Sinfonie Orchester!), eines der wenigen Games wo ich persönlich den "Ingame Sound" nicht runterschraube! Kann sich hören lassen.
Dasselbe gilt für die Synchronisation, Protagonist Cutter Slade wurde von Manfred Lehmann gesprochen (dt. Synchronstimme von Bruce Willis) auch die anderen Charaktäre können sich durchaus hören lassen. Die Persönlichkeit der unterschiedlichen Talaner ist gut synchronisiert, vom Choleriker bis zum "Baumschüler" ist alles vertreten. Mein persönlicher Favorit ist & bleibt Mogi, der rührt mich immer noch zu Tränen.

Bleibt nur noch zu sagen das es sich um ein solides Adventure handelt, das trotz der altehrwürdigen Engine dennoch mit dem Overhaul "Second Contact" mithalten kann und mancher alter Fan wirds sogar ein kleeeeeinwenig besser finden. Der guten alten Zeit halber.

Basé sur sur un background richissime, le scénario est remplit de rebondissements ainsi que de plein de dialogues de qualité. 心目中的邪典遊戲之一。

主角身處在Adelpha星球，在六個區域中探險

[list]

31307303.review:
This game has accompanied me since I was a little girl, I grew up with it and it grew even further in my imagination, longing for a second part for a very long time.

Years have passed and I reinstalled the game again and again, struggling ever more with the latest OS versions to get the game running on my aged CDs. 

Why should you buy such an old game? It is one of the rare games that gives you that feeling of belonging. It creates a wonderful world where you feel at home, bonding with its inhabitants and stories. It feels authentic, even tho its pretty old, and that is because the NPCs do have their own schedule, doing everyday things and living everyday lives under a tyranny. 
Its simple stories that make it feel so authentic and atmospheric. Like farmers having to farm food for the evil ruler, and one of them is so injured that he won't be able to make the amount he is supposed to, and thus getting executed. So you get a healer to patch him up again, and contribute at least a tiny bit.
You go on in the plot, finding out twists and odd casualities which go together in a very well composed story.

I just hope the second part of the game will keep its atmosphere and feeling of belonging. So if you have not tried the game yet, you definitely should and find a new place of home for your mind's travels :)

28886446.review:
***Save [u]often[/u], [u]alternate[/u] saves & be careful of [u]where[/u] you save*** - This will save you many headaches.

Outcast 1.1 is a great game. I'm enjoying the hell out of it, with a few exceptions. If you follow the advice above you will limit the only real issue I have with this title. There are many hours I've lost between my own negligence as well as where the game decided to shaft me. Below are a few examples of what I'm talking about.

1) When I 1st started the game. I played for about an hour, never bothering to save. I accidentally aggro'd a group of enemies that overwhelmed me & forced me to start from the beginning. (I thought I had learned my lesson)

2) After many hours of play without issue. I got complacent. I went 3 hours & made a ton of progress. I had finally reached Okaar & did a fair amount of wandering. It finally dawned on me that I had not saved in a while. I quickly saved & continued exploring. Shortly after making that crucial decision, I died. You may think I dodged that bullet, but you'd be wrong. You see I made 3 mistakes here. 1st I neglected saving earlier to another file slot. 2nd I had about 50% health. 3rd when I did save, I was standing in what I thought was a safe spot in a blow dart maze. I thought it was safe because when I stood up to save I wasn't being shot at, after I saved I still wasn't being shot at & I even made my way out of the area before I died. However when I loaded my game I was immediately hit with a dart & killed. This happened every time I tried to reload that game.

3) Every now & then the game randomly closes to desktop.
----------------------------------
With all that said, I recommend Outcast 1.1. Sure it's a bit on the ugly side & there are uncanny valley violations everywhere you look. But due to the age of it's source, this can be forgiven. The gameplay is still rock solid. The BGM & voice acting is pretty damn good. The SFX not so much, but passable. The story is very Stargate-esque, but enjoyable nonetheless. Yet with all it's flaws Outcast 1.1 is scratching all the right itches. I haven't come across a game in a while that could make that same claim.

This is well worth the $5.99. Even more so if you get it on sale.

28840767.review:
Почему стоит играть:
+ Игра из тех времён, когда земля была круглее, лето теплее а зима снежнее.
+ Превосходное музыкальное сопровождение в исполнении Московского симфонического оркестра.
+ Великолепная озвучка с юморными диалогами.
+ Глубокое погружение в мир игры. И что самое интересно, достигается это банальным способом - отсутствием маркеров целей. Приходится очень внимательно вслушиваться в диалоги. Сопоставлять услышанное с картой местности, ориентируясь по компасу. Где-о на листочке записывать цели для других районов мира. Спрашивать о местоположении нужных NPC у других NPC. Вообще, эта игра про общение, с помощью которого решается львиная доля побочных заданий. Почти всё время занимают именно разговоры с NPC, а не перестрелки.
+ ИИ врагов. Столько умных засланцев ещё поискать нужно. Они мало того, что охотно уклоняются от пуль, так ещё постоянно прячутся за укрытиями, отступают за подкреплением и пытаются обходить с флангов. И это в игре '99 года.
+ Прекрасно проработанный мир с интересным лором.
+ Интересный графический стиль. Официально значится, что он построен из воксилей, но ходят слухи, что это не совсем так. Однако нужно отдать должное игре, картинка даже по современным меркам не сильно страшная (и это 16 лет спустя) и играть вполне комфортно.

Почему не стоит играть:
- Дизайнерские ошибки в скриптах использования предметов. Например, чтобы залезть на своё ездовое животное, нужно зайти с определённой стороны под определённым углом. Не каждый до этого додумается. Некоторые предметы не берутся с первого раза. Всё это сильно портит жизнь в игре, в которой и так тяжело ввиду отсутствия маркеров
- Много никому не нужных элементов. В игре присутствует крафт патронов, которым в принципе можно не пользоваться ввиду их обилия на локации. Кроме того, есть стелс, которым пользовался только в обучении (и то этот тест завалил, и мы договорились с NPC, что он никому об этом не скаже). Ни и всякие странные предметы, которые призваны облегчить жизнь, но пользоваться ими так же не приходилось (игра к этому никак не подталкивает).
- Странная модель прицеливания. В игре присутствует автонаведение, и иногда оно сильно сбоит (в основном при перестрелках на разных уровнях в локации), что приводит к частым промахам (а патроны тут роскошь). Ну и отдельного упоминания стоит дракон, у которого учёт урона происходит уж совсем по непонятным алгоритмам.

Outcast es una de las mayores joyas que pudimos jugar en nuestros PCs a finales de los 90, una aventura de ciencia-ficción con un guion espectacular y una ambientación que te atrapa por completo, sin duda el único aspecto que realmente ha envejecido de esta obra maestra es su apartado gráfico, aunque no dejan de conservar cierto encanto retro esos voxels para los que ya disfrutamos del enorme mundo de Adelpha (el efecto de las ondas del agua en su dia era incomparable).
La historia se va desarrollando al ritmo que marca el jugador al mas puro estilo sandbox con claros matices de rpg de exploracion, cientos de conversaciones con los nativos nos iran desvelando decenas de misiones secundarias ademas de la trama principal ,a destacar el desarrollo y recuperación de nuestro armamento, es una delicia cuando unas decenas de horas despues de haber empezado con una pequeña pistola podemos acabar con todo un arsenal a nuestra disposición , por otra parte el juego puede disfrutarse en primera o tercera persona siendo la transicion entre ambas perspectivas  inmediata, cada una funciona mejor en determinadas situaciones.
De la historia que se presenta ante nosotros que decir; universos paralelos, puertas estelares , viajes en el tiempo, una autentica gozada para los amantes del genero, igual que la maravillosa banda sonora de la filarmonica de Moscú.
En definitiva una experiencia grandiosa.

27815726.review:
There's a small number of games which I've revisited numerous times, and Outcast is one of them. When it first came out, it was a gorgeous game - but the graphics were highly reliant on a powerful CPU, which meant that a lot of people couldn't actually run the game, even at its ridiculously low resolution (even at the time). As a result, the game didn't go on to become a commercial success despite being widely praised otherwise.

By the time I first laid my eyes on this gem a few years after it came out, the average gaming PC had become able to comfortably run the program with no real issues, and boy, it wasn't just a gorgeous game (despite the tiny resolution), but also an incredibly immersive one. In this game you end up exploring what was at the time a vast and expansive world with several different regions, inhabited by the Talan - an alien species - as you try to save both this world and your own (the Earth) after an experiment has gone terribly wrong.

The world is immersive, the lore draws you in, the characters are memorable and the story is satisfying. It is not a flawless game - movement can feel a bit clunky (especially jumping/climbing), there are a few ways in which you can cause bugs which prevent story progression (most notably by going to areas you're not supposed to go to early, though that's fairly difficult to do) and there are a few (very rare) situations in which you can be stunlocked until you die by some of the most elite opponents (though good planning can avoid this). However, all in all, this game was (and still is) a tremendous success, and comes highly recommended.

With Outcast 1.1, a number of the bugs related to CPUs have been fixed (a too fast CPU could break certain parts of the original game) and it's finally possible to play the game at a decent resolution. Be aware however that this game is very demanding on the CPU (even now) when played on higher resolutions. It's voxel-based graphics are rendered by the CPU, not by the GPU, so if your game is underperforming, consider lowering the resolution a little.

Mein persönliches Lieblingsspiel aller Zeiten. Als dieses Spiel veröffentlich wurde, hatte ich mir gerade einen Pentium 450 mit einer Vodoo 3 3000 gekauft. Leider brachte die Vodoo-Karte bei diesem Spiel nichts, da die Voxel-Grafik durch die CPU berechnet wurde. Dennoch war das Spiel auf meinem Rechner spielbar. Die Kritiken liessen das Spiel nicht allzu interessant erscheinen, aber da ich die Grenzen meines Rechners erkunden wollte, installierte ich die Demo des Spiels. Allein der Vorspann war für damalige Verhältnisse wahnsinnig aufwendig. Die professionelle Vertonung, u.a. die deutsche Synchronstimme von Bruce Willis (Manfred Lehmann), waren ebenfalls neuartig und mit dem genialen Soundtrack bildete sich sofort ein Gefühl des "Im-Spiel-sein", wie ich es seitdem nie wieder erlebt habe. 
Heute ist die gafische Präsentation natürlich komplett überholt, aber immer noch weiss das Spiel mit seiner Voxel-Grafik zu überzeugen. Die Geschichte ist immer noch genial erzählt, voller Humor und einiges einzigartigen Erzählstils. Wer es noch nie gespielt hat und mehr Wert auf eine Geschichte und Atmosphäre und weniger auf zeitgemäße Grafik legt, sollte diesem Spiel unbedingt eine Chance geben.

26186013.review:
Foreword:

    The original Outcast is an action-adventure game that has a special place in my heart. I received this game as a gift from my uncle from Italy in 1999. The interface was only in Italian, using the consecrated “prossimo – prossimo – prossimo – finire” (next – next – next – finish) to install the game. I found myself borrowing my mother's Romanian – Italian Dictionary as the game's interface itself was only in Italian. It was a unique experience for me, few other games impressed me (and forced me to learn a few words in Italian) as much in that period as Outcast did in 1999 (even today I have a strong positive bias towards this game that got unnoticed by most people).

    Outcast 1.1 is an updated form of the base game. It is optimized to support higher resolutions, some updates to the engine and fixed most bugs in theory.

Aesthetics:

    The visuals in Outcast did not age very well. The engine looks dated but it is functional.
The story of the game is somewhat of a cliché: People invented inter-dimensional travel. They made a big mistake and Planet Earth will be destroyed in a few weeks. They recruit Cutter Slade, the model soldier, black ops specialist; William Kauffman, the german guy that worked on the original project; Marion Wolfe the woman that is not a romantic love interest and nothing bad will ever happen to her and Anthony Xue, the guy who is never wrong... ever. They are sent through the wormhole to fix things from the other side, one after the other, Cutter Slade (the player's character) being the last (always send weak scientists first I say! Elite soldiers last!).

    When Cutter arrives in Ranzaar he discovers that Xue and Kauffman are nowhere to be seen, No women are in Adelpha (with the exception of an island you will never visit) and that Marion is taken hostage by the evil Fae Rahn. Cutter discovers that a mythical figure called Kazar has foreseen his coming and that he must collect fabled artifacts called Mons to defeat Fae Rahn and save both Adelpha and Earth.

    The five regions of Adelpha are beautiful and each has a unique aesthetic. The water, reflections, and shadows look very good (for the age it was made in), the buildings and foliage look ok-ish.

    The main characters look typical for the era, many of the characters remind me of 90's stereotypes.  The Talaan are bipedal humanoids that think Cutter is the Messiah (unless he uses innocent Talaan for target practice during the game). The Talaan characters have a very good AI most of the time, they walk around and do things depending on their profession (farmers collect produce, soldiers patrol, merchants wave their arms like idiots etc.). The AI is not perfect, there are times when a Talaan stops to hug a door, wall or other inanimate object but most of the time it adds a pleasant step of realism to the game and improves the general feel.

    The sound in the game is beautiful. The Moscow Symphonic Orchestra did its job well (the choir at the intro is exceptional and Talanzaar's oriental theme makes you feel you are an Arabian Knight) and contributes a lot to the tension during combat or the atmosphere while you are running around trying to find the Mons. I love the voice of the combat suit's AI (“HPK-12 ammo detected”, “Foreign material detected” etc.).

    The voice acting can be pretty awful, sometimes good and most of the time just average. Sometimes Cutter feels like he is reading from a script with no emotion or sometimes Fae Rahn feels like he adds too much emotion to such an extent that you end up laughing when the dialogue wants you to feel tension etc.

    Overall the game has a great aesthetic if you can get over its dated graphics. Exploring Adelpha is entertaining despite of some repetitive quests. It is a unique experience that can suck you in.

Functionality:

    The game systems work as intended.
    The interface was my worst enemy in the original game, the keyboard controls were tedious. Thank God we can customize the keyboard controls now in Outcast 1.1. This game has controller support however I cannot rate its efficiency as I did not use my controller in the game.

        The weapons work and every single one of them is deadly. You improve the weapon with different modes that you can switch through to increase the damage, radius, speed of the projectiles etc. You cannot improve Cutter's stats in any way. Not like he needs it, he is the perfect soldier.

    You can play the game in third person or first person. Most of the time third person is the way to go unless you need to shoot something with precision from a far away distance (projectiles have a fairly big range if you see something and it is not obscured you can shoot it and kill it).

    A working stealth system is in place and many times you can avoid combat if you so desire.

    The game has an open world with main and secondary tasks. Your five main tasks are to collect the Mons. Most secondary tasks (or quests... whatever) are to help the Talan either by resolving communication conflicts with your “high level mediation skills”, getting stuff for Talaan because you have a strong back, killing some bad Fae Talaan with your other "high level mediation skills", blowing stuff up for Talaan etc.

    Outcast is easy in terms of difficulty. Because the game is so easy most of the utility items will go unused despite being useful in certain situations.

     The puzzles in the game are diverse, from placing items in the right order, sound puzzles to shooting things in the right way to cause a big event that changes everything, the puzzles are fun, only a few outstay their welcome a bit (I am looking at you Okaar!).

    The game is very well optimized. My system resource consumption was very low. I never experienced a crash to desktop or encountered any game breaking bugs (only one secondary quest in Motaar was unfinishable for me and it was not because of an action I took during gameplay).

    A note: killing innocents might make the game unfinishable as many of the main tasks require you to gather information from civilians. If you kill them the others will not want to talk to you.

Enjoyment:

    The game has some less fun moments but overall it is very enjoyable. Blowing up Fae Soldiers is fun, fighting the larger beasts is amusing especially a certain serpent and T-Rex. The way stuff blows up is fun, sometimes the Talaans say and do funny things (the Ulukai song is the cringiest and funniest song in the game), Cutter has a lot of one-liners that will either make you cringe or laugh etc. Overall the game is fun most of the time, even in its more cheesy moments (unless you absolutely hate Stargate SG-1 or other 90's clichés...).

Conclusion:

    Outcast 1.1 is a classic 90's story of a hero that saves the world. For the asking price, the game is a bargain even when not on sale (just by following the main story you have a minimum of 18 - 25 hours of playtime). It is an open world game built with care, an open world where you do not chase towers or little pictographs on a map, the characters are very cheesy but they have personality, the story is not unique but it leaves you smiling up to the end. 

Other notes:

Some achievements in the game are broken or only trigger when going to another region.

25873505.review:
For me, this game had a huge impact when I first played it as a kid back when it was released. A game with full 3D graphics in a semi open world was simply unheard of. The 1.1 version accessible through Steam is therefore a trip down to memory lane. The 3D graphics are in hindsight still quite the achievement and the story itself in combination with the ironic dialogues, still makes it worth a playthrough.

However, the game is glitchy as f*ck. Achievements are not given, though quests are completed and you can get 'stuck in the graphics' at times when you just forgot to recently save your game. Another serious turndown is the lack of challenge. In the year this game was released, gameplay was probably considered 'fast', but in 2016 no one will have a challenge fighting random enemies or even bosses.

So in summary: you will enjoy this game from a nostalgic perspective, but for gamers who are up for a challenge, go get a better shooter.

7/10

25818816.review:
-Inizio con una premessa:  sconsiglio questo titolo a tutti coloro che non possono fare a meno di sistemi di teletrasporto automatico e viaggio rapido e a tutti coloro che non possono rinunciare al segnalino sulla mappa che indica il punto preciso dove andare ad eseguire la missione... su ADELPHA non esiste il GPS delle missioni, su ADELPHA si chiedono ancora le informazioni!

Detto questo non ho problemi a definire questo videogioco un capolavoro!
Un gioco pubblicato nel 1999 che, tutt'ora, in alcuni aspetti lascia a bocca aperta in quanto a cura e qualità!
Tralasciando l'aspetto puramente grafico, ancora apprezzabile grazie alla splendida versione 1.1 (se pur con quell'immancabile sapore retrò), ma ovviamente non confontrabile con le tecnoligie attuali, il titolo stupisce in quanto offre meccaniche attualissime e per certi versi ancora insuperate ai giorni nostri.

Un adventure-action, openworld, sandbox, story-driven disponibile già 17 anni fa, capace di offrire un mondo (Adelpha) estremamente vivo, credibile, dinamico e variegato; popolato di NPC gestiti da un sistema di intelligenza artificiale [il G.A.I.A]  che molti titoli moderni ancora si sognano.
Il gameplay è estremamente vario, proponendo un personaggio capace di correre, camminare, nuotare, immergersi, arrrampicarsi, strisciare furtivamente, cavalcare animali, con la possibilità di mirare e muoversi in prima persona; 
un equipaggiamento che permette approcci diversi (ad esempio: è possibile strisciare tra le fila nemiche, piazzare silenziosamente una carica di dinamite e sgattaiolare via per poi godersi l'esplosione a distanza di sicurezza!)
Tutti gli innumerevoli NPC sono doppiati in inglese in maniera coinvolgente e perfettamente sincronizzati con animazioni semplici, ma estremamente credibili e adattate al contesto.
Acclamato dalla critica e dagli utenti che lo giocarono, Outcast rimane un colosso dimenticato... Un gigante (a parer mio) della storia dei videogiochi rimasto in disparte, forse per via della potenza hardware all'epoca richiesta, forse perché troppo avanti rispetto ai tempi.
Non troverete Outcast nelle innumerevoli classifiche TOP10 degli autoproclamati "esperti di videogiochi", tuttavia non mi sento in imbarazzo a ribadire che Outcast è un capolavoro della storia dei videogiochi!

Questa remastered 1.1 è sicuramente un occasione imperdibile sia per i vecchietti (che come me) all'epoca non poterono giocarlo, sia per coloro che amano scoprire le perle del passato!

PS. menzione speciale per la colonna sonora! DAVVERO OTTIMA!

PPS. Ho nominato questo gioco per i premi di Steam, categoria: "Wow che storia!" chi leggerà la recensione potrà ben capire perché

25610644.review:
Das beste Action-Adventure, das ich bisher erleben durfte. Im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes! Hier wird einem nicht nur ein Spiel geboten, welches eine Welt mit eigener Sprache, Kulturen, Traditionen und einzigartigen Charakteren bietet, sondern ein wahres Filmfest, bei dem man selbst der Hauptdarsteller sein darf. Wenn man sich für Spiele mit grandioser Geschichte und tiefer Atmosphäre begeistern kann, ist man bei Outcast goldrichtig! Die komplexe Welt reagiert auf jede noch so kleine Handlung des Spielers, ob gut oder schlecht ist einem selbst überlassen. Man kann auf viele verschiedene Arten, die schier unendlichen Aufgaben lösen, die einem sowohl bei der Haupthandlung weiter bringen als auch bei den Nebenmissionen die Welt besser verstehen und erelben lassen. Allein der fulminante Soundtrack ist den Kaufpreis Wert. Wer sich von der inzwischen alten Voxel-Grafik nicht gestört fühlt, wird hier eine epische Geschichte miterleben und mitbestimmen dürfen!
Ich habe Outcast bereits bei erscheinen 1999 durchgespielt und freue mich nun bei der überarbeiteten Version die Geschichte erneut mitbestimmen und miterleben zu dürfen!

I remember the first time I played it to the end and the sense of wonder and awe it filled me with when discovering new areas or the story as you progress and discover what's happened before you arrived and the sadness that brings.

As many others have mentioned it was ground breaking for it's time but sadly did not meet the success it deserved, lets hope the remake can reboot this franchise and lead on to more!

24574416.review:
Outcast é um jogo de aventura clássico com uma história muito criativa e bem parecido com muitos jogos atuais vistos por aí.

Um veterano da guerra do Vietnã, William Kauffman, decide colocar suas teorias sobre a existência de um "Mundo Paralelo", tendo Anthony Xue como seu ajudante nessa tarefa. Kauffman com a ajuda do governo americano resolvem lançar uma sonda que seria capaz de trazer provas da existência desse tal mundo paralelo. A experiência dá certo, porém um pequeno dano na sonda acaba causando um desastre. Violentas ondas de choque são geradas no planeta, em consequência disso um buraco negro é criado, então o governo decide agir. 
Você assume o papel de Cutter Slade, um Navy Seal da marinha americana com a missão de resolver tudo isso, então Slade e um grupo de cientistas são enviados para o tal mundo paralelo. Ele acorda na região de Ranzaar, no planeta Adelpha, com guardiões de uma raça estranha chamada Talan cuidando dele, mas nenhum sinal do grupo que tinha o acompanhado nessa viagem. Os Talan acabam achando que Slade é uma espécie de deus chamado Ulukai, que fora enviado pelos seus ancestrais, os Yods, para salvar Adelpha, tendo assim que recuperar 5 artefatos chamados de Mon espalhados pelas outras 5 regiões de Adelpha (Shamazaar, Talanzaar, Motazaar, Okasankaar e Okaar), após isso fazer os Talan pararem de obedecer o ditador Fae Rhan, assim podendo matar este e seu "sócio, Kroax, libertando assim o planeta e podendo voltar para casa.

A história do jogo é bem rica, e se você conversar com todos os NPCs, você vai entender bem mais e muito melhor. São muitos NPCs para conversar e alguns te dão quests secundárias, para aumentar seu tempo de jogo (que não é curto, aproximadamente 20-25 horas de campanha). 

A jogabilidade é simples e boa, você pode: andar, correr, pular, andar se arrastando, atirar (com um arsenal de 6 armas, das quais 5 você precisa comprar de vendedores na cidade de Okriana, na região de Talanzaar), usar itens de seu inventário, entre outras coisas. A mira para alguns pode não ser lá essas coisas (é de laser, estilo re4), pois você não tem livre controle sobre ela em terceira pessoa, mas aí vai uma dica: enquanto mira, aperte 'Control' e o jogo muda para primeira pessoa, deixando bem mais fácil. 

Cada região do jogo é relativamente grande, com muitos inimigos, NPCs e itens escondidos, o que faz a exploração essencial nesse jogo. 

A trilha sonora é excepcional, uma das minhas preferidas de todos os tempos, clique [b][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHt96IQpWYs]aqui[/url][/b] caso queira ouvir.

Outcast é um jogo de aventura incrível e muito revolucionário para sua época e até hoje sendo bem divertido. Por sua história bem elaborada, cativante, personagens carismáticos e marcantes, exploração, side quests e campanha relativamente demorada. Qualquer amante de clássicos, RPGs, jogos de mundo aberto e afins deve jogar Outcast.

De onde será que Skyrim tirou sua inspiração? He he.

The remake of a classic, available on Steam with some updates on it.

I never played the original, but is is considered one of the first 3D open world games.

All in all, the game has some flaws but they are auite minor especially given its age, and as such I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Pros:
- Good story, with a very fleshed out game world.
- Open World and RPG elements (quests, weapons upgrades, NPC trade).
- Spectacular soundtrack.
- Good AI for the year it was released.
- The graphics may look strange now, but they are part of the experience.

Cons:
- Gameplay a bit difficult to get used to if you're used to today's games.
- Some bugs still exist throughout the game but nothing serious.
- For achievements hunters, some of them are currently unobtainable.

Recommended, especially for its low price.

24122714.review:
outcast is simply one of the greatest games since 1999: 

it offers outstanding worldbuilding!!! (this, for me, is the most importatnt aspect of the game besides its story. and that is surprising at first glance, because outcast is, first and for most, an action-adventure and not an RPG, thou it has various elements of that genre in it, like: a well thought out, not too artificial crafting system, non-linear story progression, a huge world that can be explored by the player from quite early on in the game, and a huge variety of items to your proposal).

furthermore it delivers very well on the narrative side of things, with good written dialogs, authentic, "on point", voiceacting (which never comes of cheesy or, and thats worst and far more often the case, lazy, like so many characters in games nowadays (the german voice of alyx vance in HL2 or the MP-narrator in the newest doom, just to name a few) btw: im playing the german version of the game. 

the drama of the story fuels itself by stakes, which are very high set in this game, everyone has to loose a lot...and the game makes you feel that from time to time... but never gets depressing! the game has a lot of humor in it, which works great to keep you entertained ... and which is actually funny. sad to point this out, but good humor in games is rare theese days: most stuff they bring up is boring klishees, prototypes, and lame one-liners. exceptions granted). 
good story comes with interesting characters, and outcast got theese as well, tons of em.

plus it has a phenomenal soundtrack, which creates precisely defined (and therefore very dense) atmospheres for each of the different and unique enviroments (the OST was performed by the moscow symphony orchestra). 

even the graphics (enviroments i must add, charactermodels not so much ;) still look more than decent and have overall aged very well (in ´99 they were far far beyond their time: water effects, drawdistance, special effects, lighning, you name it, all essets and effects were state of the art... and you got all of that visual quality without gpu accelleration: the whole thing runs on a cpu exclusive engine o.O! granted: back in the days nobody could run this beyond 20fps thou. glad to be here in 2016 with a 1080p version of the game, which on my pc (i5 3570k, 8GB ram) rarely mekes it beyond the 60fps mark). 

the artdesign of the world and its inhabitants is pretty original and comes off very "organic" looking. a wide ranged colorpallet is being used throughout the world. that, and its beautifully drawn skyboxes (which were enhanced for the 1.1 version if im not wrong), makes the 5 regions highly distinguishable from each other, and giving each of them their own feel (a desert mining world where the "people" (like most of the time) are somewhat slaves, snowy hideouts, swamps with fishermen doing their job, jungles with ancient ruins sprinkled over them etc.). all comes together wonderfully.

the effort that went in to the game (and to be quite frank here, that is what must have killed it eventually, from a financial point of view...), is just mindblowing (they even created a UNIQUE LANGUAGE for this game (!), the characters inhabiting the world (adelpha) speak in a certain vocabular, which grows on you (and your alter ego "cutter") by the time you playing it. simply amazing stuff.

to make a long story short: i really love this game! outcast was, and is, a true masterpiece, no doubt about it. and it is very sad that it didnt got the recognition it clearly deserved (thou heavily praised by critics at that time) ... a reason for that could be, that is unfortunatly came out at the same time as tomb raider 3 and indianer jones, if i remember it correctly. very glad to have the 1.1 version (comes with various improvements, like support for multicore cpus, achievments and all that good jazz).

i highly recommend it to anybody who likes videogames.

They do this even with the NPCs walking around so they are dymanically updating their position instead of NPCs being stuck in one place until you find them.

The game also has 172 achievements.  I've recently started become interested in earning steam achievements and this is a great game to get some.  Ten hours into the game and only have 20 out of 172 achielvements.  Not bad for $5.99.

23114364.review:
Il ne faut pas se fier aux apparences. Certes, le graphisme est clairement daté, même sur cette version remasterisée. Mais ce détail devient insignifiant, quand on s'intéresse à la profondeur de ce jeu. Un scénario qui vous baladera une trentaine d'heures durant, avec la possibilité de rencontrer des autochtones aux personnalités très diverses. Votre héros a lui un charisme a tout épreuve, et l'incarner est un vrai plaisir. Très cynique, maniant l'ironie à merveille, ses répliques sont un plaisir à l'écoute. Car oui, le jeu est entièrement doublé ! Et même si ça grésille pas mal sur certaines fréquences, le travail de doublage est de grande qualité. Surtout celui du protagoniste principal. Il est rare de sourire - voire de rire -aussi souvent que dans Outcast, en écoutant certaines conversations complètement barrées.
On est sinon en présence d'un jeu qui alterne entre exploration et combats FPS. 6 armes, chacune avec un gameplay très différent, que l'on pourra améliorer 2 fois chacun. 6 mondes également, avec leur faune et leur flore propre. Vos ennemis ne seront cependant pas très variés, avec une très grande proportion de soldats de grades différents, souvent en grand nombre. A noter qu'il n'y a quasiment pas de respawn, ce qui est une bonne chose pour ceux qui aiment nettoyer toutes les cartes.
On passe vraiment un excellent moment devant cette version modernisée, qui permet à une nouvelle génération de joueurs ( ou aux nostalgiques comme moi ) de découvrir ce pur bijou !
Seuls les allers/retours incessants entre les divers mondes, et la gestion un peu lourdingue des sauvegardes pourront parfois vous refroidir. Mais pour un prix aussi dérisoire, ce jeu est presque un cadeau que l'éditeur vous fait. A posséder impérativement !

21765327.review:
"Улукай, хо!" - Приветствуют игрока Таланы. Они - гуманоиды, населяющие мир "Адельфа", а вы - Каттер Слейд, бывший спецназовец, которому поручено спасти Землю. 
Теперь по порядку. Однажды учёным удалось запустить зонд в параллельную вселенную - потрясающее свершение! Местные аборигены, однако, агрессивно отнеслись к посланному подарку и расстреляли его, что по неизвестным причинам вызвало появление аналога червоточины с "земной" стороны. Вся ситуация грозила полным уничтожением человеческой цивилизации, в связи с чем в параллельный мир отправили двух учёных и двух солдат для решения проблемы. Всё, однако, идёт не по плану™, и главный герой остаётся один - без оружия, без снаряжения, без попутчиков. Местные аборигены, однако, упорно зовут его "Улукай", рассказывают о пророчестве, о спасении мира от тирана, о хаосе и бедствиях. Каттер заключает с Таланами договор: он решает их проблемы, а они решают его. На том и порешили, дальше - достаточно большой по меркам того времени мир, разделённый на области с порталами-переходами, море квестов и приключений. Тут вам и болотистые рисовые поля, и восточный рынок посреди пустыни, и рыбацкая деревушка с тюрьмой, и заснеженная база повстанцев, и даже заполненные лавой бывшие шахты по добыче ценных минералов. И везде есть чем заняться.
Outcast - приключенческая игра, изданная в 1999 году и переизданная в 2014 (Steam, GOG) с некоторыми улучшениями. Для современного глаза графика может показаться неказистой, но по меркам того времени это был чуть ли не прорыв (если мне не изменяет память), да и не на ней упор. Атмосфера чужого мира, в котором ты - мессия, множество квестов, закрученный сюжет, приключения и шуточки, которые даже после многих лет не перестают радовать. К примеру, игру мы сохраняем с помощью кристалла "Гаам Саав", который "сохраняет и оберегает в себе твою сущность". Гениально. Сохраняться, кстати, можно только когда рядом нет врагов - нужно стоять неподвижно секунды три. 
Ах да, пострелять вам тоже придётся. Много. Благо, арсенала (и его модификаций) хватает.
Игра запоминается тем, что в ней просто весело находиться. Бегать туда-сюда по карте, решать чужие проблемы, выяснять, что же такое "Горгоров зорт" или "Мон", двадцать раз подряд пытаться запрыгнуть на верхнюю ступеньку погасшего маяка (будь он неладен), выяснять, что же в конце концов здесь произошло и откуда о Каттере знают все местные жители. Ну и, может быть, когда-нибудь кто-то разгадает, в конце-то концов, загадку разрушенной даоки в Окааре... 
Музыку, кстати, исполнял Московский симфонический оркестр и хор. Очень рекомендую к ознакомлению. Лично для меня - нетленная классика.

21283844.review:
Ulukai ho!

Outcast is one of those strange chunks of video game history that remain timeless and continues to expand its cult following every year. And rightfully so , this game was way ahead of its time. Although hub based, the open world feels really full of life and diverse. It offers freedom few games at the time offered. Sneaking and/or third/first person shooting  your way trough a sci-fi open world? Upgradeable weapons? Numerous VOICED dialog options for each and every NPC you come across?  You can ride animals even? Teenage me would have wet his pants. Sadly I have missed this game when it came out , but now ,after all those years I can safely say this is one of the best games of '99. The orchestral soundtrack rocks my world. I have continued listening to it even after completing the game. Something I can say for few games.

20323694.review:
Sehr gelungenes Remake eines Klassikers, der nostalgische Gefühle weckt. Es läuft für meine Begriffe angenehm stabil (das Original war da z.T. sehr absturzanfällig) und skaliert gut auf modernen Displays. Ansonsten präsentiert es sich sehr nahe am Originalspiel mit nur subtilen Überarbeitungen von Texturen und Grafiken. Mit einigen Glitches ist jedoch zu rechnen, z.B. dass bei dem ein oder anderen Dialog die Sprachausgabe mal abbricht, weil die Szene zu früh endet.

Inhaltlich ist Outcast ein atmosphärisches Action-Adventure, in dem es eine große, fremdartige Welt zu entdecken gilt. Gewalt als Lösungsweg ist zwar in einigen Fällen möglich, aber weniger lohnend als List und Geschick, in anderen Fällen bedeutet sie den sicheren Ruin; von daher würde ich hier keine großen Gefahren für jüngere Spieler sehen.
An vielen Stellen ist Geschicklichkeit und Geduld gefragt, um an verborgene Orte zu gelangen oder die richtige Taktik für eine Spielsituation auszuknobeln. An anderen reagiert der Held erfrischend menschlich (etwa auf nervige Flötenmusik).

Wer Outcast nicht kennt und zeitgenössische Spiele gewönt ist und erwartet, wird hier allerdings eher enttäuscht sein. Die Steuerung ist für heutige Verhältnisse hakelig, die Grafik altbacken und die NPCs bewegen sich allzu künstlich.
Da es sich offensichtlich um ein Remake handelt, gehe ich aber davon aus, dass man sich als Käufer dessen bewusst ist und spreche meine Empfehlung eben im Sinne einer gelungenen Neuauflage eines alten, geschätzten Spiels aus.

Ich hoffe ja immer noch auf eine Fortsetzung...

I finally played it through again, and I must say I still enjoy it, even after all these years. But I am not really sure that would be the case if I hadn't such big nostalgia for it. It was a bit like visiting old friends *sniff*

But I would never expect new players to enjoy Outcast as much as I did, even with the improvements the developers added. I still recommend it, of course, as it is one of my favourite games. My personal pro points regarding Outcast are the atmosphere, the fact that you can do a lot of quests, the music (oh, that music!), the nonlinearity and often the humor. And the music.

But yeah, the combat is a bit halfbaked, the story doesn't always make sense (although it's very immersive) and you will do a lot of walking to get to the different places, but luckily there are shortcuts if you use your tools right. And I wish the developers wouldn't have added so many achievements, as they tend to negate the atmosphere and immersion a bit. 

Overall, Outcast is a rewarding experience, if you can ignore its shortcomings.

Preface: I personally can't stand spoilers, so I will avoid them entirely.

In my opinion, this game is the Ocarina of Time for kids who grew up with a PC.

You travel back and forth across the world of Adelpha and end up talking to quite a few of the NPCs a number of times, allowing you to genuinely get to know their personalities and motivations and why you like or dislike them.

You obtain a variety of items and weapons to keep things fresh as you reach new areas.

You have plenty of reason to revisit areas -and for quite a bit more than just merchants or things you left behind.

Nothing despawns. Ever. If you kill a guy and he drops money you didn't grab, it'll be there 20 hours later.

If you killed an enemy, it remains dead, forever.



+A ton of great content to explore.
+Great variety in tasks, weapons, and enemies.
+Decent challenge

-Developed before graphics accelerators, built on CPU rendering so the game isn't gorgeous
-Some of the quests aren't very clear on what to do/where to go next
-Not enough people backed the kickstarter to modernize the game

Summary: Despite not being the prettiest game, Outcast 1.1 is a MUST buy for anyone who likes action/adventure games.

17051066.review:
[b]Pros:[/b]
-Remake of a 1999 classic, done well (remember those bugs from before?  A lot are gone now)
-Six weapons that each cover different needs without being overbearing or tedious; all are useful
-Seven continents to explore, with massive amounts of content
-Rewards skill and exploration
-Full orchestral soundtrack that is *amazing*

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Dated graphics
-Sometimes the physics can be clunky
-No quest markers; you have to find your way around
-No maps; you have to figure out where you are
-That flute guy.  You'll know him when you meet him.


[b]Overall:[/b] Outcast is a game released in 1999.  Expect 1999 graphics.  But if you can get past the graphics, you'll experience a fantastic game with a solid storyline that doesn't take itself too seriously but still manages to be compelling.  The amount of content in this game for the price is staggering, and the world draws you in easily.  This remastered version fixes several bugs and blatant issues that were present in the CD release (like some obvious missing quests and the SLNT-B upgrades), and makes it play smoothly on modern systems.  It's a lot of fun, and for the price, definitely a lot of bang for your buck.


[b]Bottom Line:[/b] Definite recommend for the price.

16567430.review:
C'est avec nostalgie que je me suis relancé dans cette aventure, non sans appréhension vu son âge avancé.
La version proposée ne fait pas de miracle et se contente de mettre à notre disposition un titre qui a marqué l'histoire du jeu vidéo sans le dénaturer. Adaptation aux machines modernes, intégration à Steam, support de contrôleur XBox et c'est à peu près tout.
Alors côté graphisme, ne vous attendez pas à une tuerie mais appréciez plutôt ce que les développeurs étaient capables de faire il y a de ça maintenant 16 ans. Impressionnant.
Quant au contenu, il a de quoi faire pâlir une grande majorité des jeux d'action/aventure actuels et c'est peu dire.

[h1] Points forts [/h1]
[list]
    [*] L'Univers cohérent, vivant et intéressant.
    [*] Les dialogues et leurs doublages français (mention spéciale à Patrick Poivey, la voix française de Bruce Willis).
    [*] L'intelligence artificielle franchement pas mal pour l'époque (fuite, esquive, comportement spécifique lié à une arme...).
    [*] Les quêtes très variées (on est loin du sempiternel tuer, ramasser, escorter) dans un monde ouvert.
    [*] Le système de combat pêchu et des armes sympa à utiliser.
    [*] La musique symphonique de très grande qualité.
    [*] La durée de vie que l'on peut estimer à une 20ène d'heures au minimum.
[/list]

[h1] Faiblesses [/h1]
[list]
    [*] Un moteur Voxel qui a fait ses preuves avec son cachet si particulier mais qui accuse évidemment le poids des années.
    [*] Les animations et les cinématiques temps-réel (RTC) qui malgré les efforts louables de mise en scène sont dépassées techniquement.
    [*] Quelques détails dans l'ergonomie ou la jouabilité, domaine où l'on a fait quelques avancées depuis.
Par exemple notre monture ne passe pas partout et on doit la laisser de côté régulièrement ou alors les PNJs qu'il est parfois fastidieux de dénicher dans la cité d'Okriana. Hé oui, il n'y a pas d'indicateur sur la carte ou de signe de ponctuation sur leur tête et il faut régulièrement demander son chemin aux nombreux badauds.
[/list]

Outcast est un grand jeu, un très grand jeu même. Il arrive encore aujourd'hui à me faire réaliser combien les grosses productions actuelles manquent cruellement de créativité, d'inventivité et surtout d'âme. Ce jeu respire la passion, celle-là même qui se perd aujourd'hui dans les méandres d'une industrie basée sur le profit.

Un jeu franco-belge à découvrir ou redécouvrir pour les plus anciens. [b]9/10[/b]

16485636.review:
Ah, the nostalgia! What a classic of its time, unfortunately not successful enough for Infogrames (now Atari) to finance a sequel. I gladly remember being addicted to the game and being a regular member of the Infogrames forums back in the day, being part of an awesome community and helping a lot of people with the many secrets and and complexities Outcast had to offer.

The voxel engine was and still is a curiosity, resulting in a natural, non-blocky environment. While the textures are quite low-quality compared to today's standards, it is still a decently looking game. The high resolution of the remake helps with that. I am still stunned by the music and find myself regularly humming it while traversing the beautiful landscapes.

I would claim the AI is still up to today's standard, the enemies seem smarter than in Skyrim (that's not saying much, but it's something). And the population with its diverse day-to-day routines make up for a believable world, which was revolutionary back then and holds up to this day.

The remake has been well done and deserves - unlike other so-called "remakes" - its name. The developer did a good job and even fixed some long-standing bugs. The introduction of the achievements was a really good thing: It highlights not-so-obvious sidequests that many people missed when the game was orginally released.

If you can live with a few quirks here and there (the game is 16 years old after all!), I can recommend Outcast 1.1 from the bottom of my heart. A dirt cheap price for an atmospheric experience many modern games aren't able to deliver.

Immerse yourself into the world of Adelpha and enjoy :)

Die Spielwelt ist abwechslungsreich und glaubhaft und erzeugt eine sehr sehr dichte Athmosphäre. Jede Region hat ihren höchst eigenen Charme. Zum Beispiel wird der Protagonist von Manfred Lehmann, der deutschen Stimme von Bruce Willis, gesprochen und passt zu Cuter Slate wie "... auf Eimer." 

Hinzu kommt eine wunderbare, von einem Orchester aufgenommene Musikuntermalung, die das ganze abrundet. 

Ich kann dieses Spiel jedem  nur wärmstens empfehlen! Viel Spaß!

15649467.review:
First things first, let's make my feelings on this game clear: I place Outcast among my favourite games of all time, right up there with Deus Ex, Fallout 2, Half-Life and other classics. It's a masterpiece, and it still holds up incredibly well. The graphics may have dated, but the gameplay is still really solid and to this day very few games have managed to match the sheer amount of depth and effort Appeal poured into the alien world they created, which feels like a genuine place with its own culture and language. Even the score is excellent and it's one of the very few orchestral scores I rate.

But Outcast 1.1 is a little problematic. The little improvements it does on the technical side of things are fairly negligible compared to the sheer amount of issues it presents. It's glitchy as hell: during my playthrough I encountered various bugs from the minor (achievements being triggered by cutscene actions) to the genuinely bothersome (certain sidequests were impossible to complete due to critical items vanishing, while others simply never triggered). These issues were never present in the original or the GoG release a while back, so I'm a little hesitant in calling the Steam release wonderful. 

My advice? Unless you're really hardcore about Steam or really want those trading cards or achievements (some of which require you to do some really stupid things you would never dream of doing otherwise), get the GoG release. It's smoother and stabler. The positive recommendation is for the game itself.

15307876.review:
1. Story
Man ist Cutter Slade. Navy Seal. Nach einem verunglückten Versuch, eine Sonde auf einen anderen Planeten zu schicken, tut sich auf der Erde ein schwarzes Loch auf. Nun wird man als Teil eines vierköpfigen Teams losgeschickt, die Sonde zu reparieren. Als man dann auf dem Planeten Adelpha ankommt, ist man aber vom Rest des Teams getrennt worden und hat seine Ausrüstung verloren. Nun ist es am Spieler rauszufinden, was passiert ist. Wo sind die anderen Teammitglieder. Wer hat die Ausrüstung und warum wird man von allen Ulukai genannt. 

2. Gameplay
Das Spiel spielt sich wie andere Vertreter des Action Adventure Genre wie z.B. Risen. Man bereist eine offene Welt, löst Räsel und Aufgaben. Meist ist man zu Fuß in den 5 Welten unterwegs. Diese unscheiden sich deutlich im Aussehen. So gibt es Risianbaugebiete mit Tempelwelt oder auch eine große Stadt. Eine Besonderheit ist die Spache So muss man wirklich ein paar Vokabeln lernen, um im Spiel klar zu kommen. Ansonsten sind die Aufgaben sehr abwechslungsreich. Auch haben mache gelöste Aufgaben richtige Auswirkungen. Wenn man z.B. das Gebiet Shamazaar befreit hat, bekommen die Gegner keine Nahrung mehr und werden schächer, was man direkt merkt, da man weniger Treffer benötigt, um einen Gegner zu töten. Ein Highlight sind auch die Dialoge. Cutter Slade wird von der deutsche Stimme von Bruce Willis gesprochen und diese ist perfekt. Zumal Cutter sehr zynisch ist. Das sorgt oft für gute Laune.

3. Grafik/Technik
Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr alt geworden. Zwar sehen die Wassereffekte noch immer schick aus, aber Texturen sind matschig und Polygonanzahl ist sehr gering. Aber das Spiel ist von 1999. Damals habe ich dafür meinen PC aufgerüstet. Toll ist noch immer der orchestrale Soundtrack. Die Steuerung mit Maus und Tastatur geht gut von der Hand. Die neue Version kann man auch mit Gamepad spielen. Das habe ich aber nicht getestet. Das Spiel lief stabiel. Es gab einen Abstutz, das lag aber weniger am Spiel =)

4. Fazit
Immer noch ein tolles Spiel. Schöne Aufgaben, abwechslungsreiche Gebiete und der tolle Score lassen einen tief ins Spiel eintauchen. Wenn man über die angestaubte Grafik hinwegsehen kann, erwartet einen ein tolles Abenteuer mit überraschender Story. 

PS: Das Spiel bietet über 150 Achievments. Wer also welche sammelt, kann bei einem normalem Durchgang locker über 100 mitnehmen. 
PPS: Bei Fragen zum Review bzw. Spiel stehe ich gerne bereit. 

PC: 
Intel i5 2500K @ 4Ghz
16 GB Ram
nVidia GF 970 mit 349.90
Win 10 64 Bit

15294472.review:
[h1]História[/h1]

Em 2007, o governo americano enviou uma sonda destinada a trazer provas da existência de um universo paralelo. A experiência obteve sucesso e imagens do novo mundo chegaram a Terra. Alguns minutos depois, uma forma de vida alienígena atacou e destruiu a sonda, causando um lapso de energia que deu origem a um pequeno buraco-negro, ameaçando toda a existência humana. Após o incidente, Cutter Slade, ex-fuzileiro da marinha americana é eleito para escoltar três cientistas à outra dimensão, com a missão de recuperar a sonda e fechar o buraco-negro. 

Ao despertar sem seus companheiros no outro lado, Cutter se depara com uma raça alienígena inteligente chamada Talan. Os Talans acreditam que o Cutter Slade é Ulukai, seu grande messias, que reunirá os cinco Mons sagrados, derrotará o ditador Fae Rhan e salvará Adelpha.

Separado de seus amigos, sem seu equipamento e não tendo conhecimento desta estranha existência, Cutter Slade decide procurar pelos Mons enquanto os Guardiões Dolotai, um grupo de Talans que se opõe à Fae Rhan, prometem procurar pela sonda e pelos três cientistas.

O jogo possui muitas reviravoltas e surpresas no enredo. Adelpha é um mundo vivo, onde todos os elementos são explicados. O método de salvamento do jogo, o motivo dos Talans falarem inglês, enfim, tudo tem um motivo para existir, aumentando ainda mais o fascínio e a imersividade do jogador. Além disso, existem diversos personagens memoráveis, cada qual com sua personalidade, seus valores e sua opinião sobre o Ulukai e Fae Rhan.

[h1]Jogabilidade[/h1]

A jogabilidade pode ser divida em três partes principais: o sistema de combate, os diálogos e a exploração, e a resolução de quebra-cabeças e missões.

O sistema de combate é bem simples, porém efetivo. O princípio funciona praticamente como o "iron sight" dos jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa atuais. Com o botão secundário do mouse, Cutter mira com auxílio de um feixe de laser vermelho, e com o botão primário, dispara a arma. A mecânica serve tanto para o modo padrão em terceira pessoa quanto para a câmera alternativa em primeira pessoa. Existem diversas armas, cada qual com sua utilidade. Temos a pistola padrão, a HKP-12, além das variantes para submetralhadora, morteiro, lança-mísseis, lança-chamas e rifle de precisão. Todas as armas podem ser melhoradas com módulos vendidos por comerciantes que encontraram os objetos "sagrados", perdidos pelo Ulukai em sua chegada à Adelpha. Também contamos com diversos outros itens especiais, que em conjunto com as armas, podem facilitar algumas sequências e até salvar a vida de nosso protagonista. Dentre estes, temos a invisibilidade para passar despercebido pelos inimigos, a imagem holográfica que pode ser usada como distração, a dinamite para explodir um grupo de oponentes, dentre outros.

Os inimigos normalmente são animais da fauna de Adelpha ou soldados de Fae Rhan. A inteligência artificial dos animais é bem básica, mas a dos soldados chega a impressionar até para os padrões atuais em determinadas situações. Normalmente estes soldados avançam em grupo, com armas poderosas, utilizando o cenário como vantagem para atacar e se defender.

A exploração é dada através de uma navegadora eletrônica que detecta e informa todos os itens e formas de energia que se encontram nas proximidades de Ulukai, além de disponibilizar um mini-mapa quando o visor está ativo. Outro instrumento de auxílio é o binóculo, que além de providenciar uma visão de longo alcance, possui um sensor de raios-X que permite enxergar através de materiais sólidos. Cada uma das cinco regiões de Adelpha é consideravelmente grande e livre para exploração, podendo ser acessadas a qualquer momento através dos Daokas, os portais como são chamados na língua nativa. 

A busca por informações é fundamental em Outcast. Neste jogo, os diálogos são tão importantes quanto em um RPG tradicional. É através da conversação com os Talans que descobrimos nossos objetivos, como encontrar alguém, onde fica determinado local, além de providenciar diversas informações sobre cultura, religião, política e vida pessoal. Vários destes diálogos são muito engraçados devido à natureza sarcástica do protagonista. 

O jogo também possui uma atmosfera muito envolvente, onde cada Talan cumpre seus afazeres e vive sua vida de uma maneira única. Por causa desta movimentação constante, precisamos perguntar para qualquer um onde encontrar determinado personagem. Caso esteja no campo de visão do questionado, ele simplesmente aponta para o alvo, senão diz onde o viu pela última vez.

O objetivo principal do protagonista é encontrar a sonda e os cinco Mons sagrados, mas o jogo não se resume à missão principal. O Ulukai também precisa convencer os Talans a se voltarem contra seu ditador. Através da ajuda espontânea, precisamos gradativamente convencer os nativos que somos de fato seu messias. Neste sentido Outcast lembra muito o clássico Shenmue da Sega, pois encontramos situações naturais onde nossa interferência pode causar um grande impacto nos olhos dos outros habitantes de Adelpha. Outra meta importante é convencer os líderes de cada região a cortar os suprimentos que são enviados ao exército de Fae Rhan. Os soldados ficam mais fracos quanto não sem comida, armas, dinheiro e mantimentos para lutar.

Todos estes três fundamentos da jogabilidade estão juntos, entrelaçados, tornando Outcast uma experiência única e completa.

[h1]Gráficos e Trilha Sonora[/h1]

Hoje pode não parecer, mas Outcast teve um dos gráficos mais impressionantes na época de seu lançamento. De contrapartida a outros jogos lançados naquele período, a "engine" da Appeal é totalmente rodada em modo "software", pelo processador, sem utilizar as placas de vídeo que já eram o padrão no final daquela década.

O jogo impressionou pelo tamanho dos cenários, pela quantidade de detalhes e pelo número de personagens exibidos na tela simultaneamente. Algumas técnicas gráficas estavam à frente de seu tempo, e só vieram a ser usadas anos depois. Por exemplo, todo o terreno é renderizado com voxels (pixels tridimensionais), criando um volume e detalhamento que nenhum outro jogo possuía. Tal técnica só foi reutilizada em Crysis, jogo lançado em 2007. Além deste, Oucast contava com efeitos que só tornaram-se padrão nestes últimos anos, como os conhecidos "Depth of Field", "Bump-Mapping", "Bloom", "Anti-Aliasing", sombras, reflexos na água e partículas volumétricas. Este também foi um dos pioneiros na captura de movimentos.

Apesar de fazer brilhar os olhos de um jogador de 1999, poucos foram aqueles que conseguiram rodar o jogo em toda sua plenitude. Isto pode ter influenciado as baixas vendas que infelizmente fizeram com que a produtora fechasse suas portas durante o desenvolvimento da sequência.

Os atores de voz fizeram um excelente trabalho dando vida à todas as personagens do jogo. Vale lembrar que esta também foi uma inovação introduzida por Outcast, pois nenhum outro jogo da época com o mesmo volume de diálogos conseguiu trazer todas as falas dubladas.

Mesmo com ótimos efeitos sonoros e dublagem, o maior destaque deste quesito são as músicas orquestradas, produzida por Lennie Moore e executadas pela Orquestra Sinfônica de Moscou. Cada peça consegue transmitir exatamente o que estamos vendo no momento, fazendo-nos esquecer estarmos na frente do computador divertindo-nos com um jogo eletrônico.

[h1]Conclusão[/h1]

Outcast foi uma experiência única. Fui transportado para outro mundo, aprendi um idioma diferente e conheci outra cultura, com religião, política e costumes muito diferentes dos nossos. Por este motivo considero Outcast um dos dez melhores jogos de todos os tempos. 

Aos aventureiros que decidirem viajar para Adelpha, que os Yods fiquem silenciosos durante sua longa e divertida jornada.

15278167.review:
I remember way back when, when I was a small, foolish child who could barely understand english. Even though all I had was the demo version of Outcast, I knew it was a fantastic game, and I'd play it day after day. And now, here I am, happy to say it still occupies my slot of #1 favorite game of all time.

The world is the most alive I've ever experienced, even moreso than any modern games that boast having a living world to this day. The characters and story are interesting, there's so much to discover about the world of Adelpha, and everything has an interesting or funny in-universe reason for being the way it is - right down to why the keys only work once before they break.
And the combat is just plain fun! Every weapon firing relatively slow-moving projectiles means you have to run and jump around, making fights really active, and even encouraging laying traps for the enemies trying to get behind you. And if that's not your cup of tea, you can sneak around, and even do objectives that weaken your foes, so there's really something for everyone.
The voice acting is excellent, the music is gorgeous and perfectly fits the atmosphere, and the whole game feels so expansive and organic.

Outcast is a very old game, yes, but Outcast 1.1 has made many, many improvements. It was nigh impossible to get it to run properly on modern computers before, and even the GOG version caused me major issues. The screen's flickering, Cutter walks too slowly, I can't get up on this platform I absolutely have to reach, etc.
Now, it's fixed, and every little problem that the game had has been solved, and the problems that it still has are getting quickly taken care of day by day.

Outcast has always been perfect in my eyes, and now that the developers are back and actively improving it, it's even more so.

14821859.review:
I bought Outcast in 1999, shortly after release and it has been one of my favourite games of all time. Perhaps, nostalgia is one of the main factors but one can not deny Outcast is/was a solid adventure game. 

Outcast takes you on a sci-fi journey in a parallel universe in which you are on a quest to save not one, but two worlds. The world filled with strange creatures and inhabitants and a rich story with romance and deceit.

Back in '99, Outcast was way ahead of it's time using technologies which haven't (often) been seen in other games. Technologies like: Lip Sync and characters would actually look you in the eyes. Outcast was one of the first 3D Sandbox games (as far as I know) with beautiful graphics. The world is amazing and fun to explore and every npc has his own role in the game. The CGI also was ahead of it's time and pretty well done combined with the terrific orchestral soundtracks. Due to this, the game's production costs were very high, which should not be a real problem if it sells.

Sadly, Outcast did not sell well, even though almost every game magazine gave it a perfect rating. A developing attempt was made for Outcast 2 but this never happened. The kickstarter for an Outcast remake failed aswell, so the only way we ever get to see an Outcast 2 is if the classic sells well. 

Obviously, Nowadays this is not the prettiest game anymore and the controlls are a bit wonky. Still, Outcast remains a great sci-fi experience and it's still well playable. I recommend this game to anyone who is not afraid of aged graphics and just want an amazing experience playing one of the best games ever made.

14221456.review:
The only words I can think of to describe this game are " B-rank cult classic." 

The story is cheesy yet entertaining; for example, you travel to another dimension (interesting), but the dialog is hilarious (like the reason for doing so is because the world is facing a “diamond-level threat,” apparently). The made up alien language sounds silly, and they somehow also speak English (or at least it seems that way). But it’s entertaining. It’s one of those things that are so cheesy they’re lovable.

The same can be said for the animation; it’s basically a lower-resolution version of Team America. The forehead wrinkles and eyebrow movement must have been new at the time, because they certainly spared no expense in using them. The price of admission is worth it just to watch the hilarious expressions the characters make.  And the mouth movement is pretty much exactly like Team America, because of the limited jaw movement available for the character models.

And the controls! They’re just as amusing as the story and animation! They’re just so weird. For example, when you first start and if you haven’t drawn your weapon, the left mouse button is a jump button. It’s completely weird and doesn’t really work, but it’s so quirky that it’s entertaining! Also, the screen text read, “Press the Space Bar to crawl,” but that also made me jump. I just messed with the buttons until I figured out that C was to crawl.

Character interaction was amusing too; I was trying to figure out how to stealth in the game for a quest, kept failing because of the weird buttons (was slowly getting it), and apparently the character took pity on me and then gave me an item to help me out…and the item wasn’t even remotely useful for that one quest haha. Anyway, failed again just because the funky controls (was my first quest and apparently was supposed to be the “hard” quest), and rather than make me do the quest…the character was like “Don’t worry…a lot of the young warriors can’t complete this quest…” Basically, I received the ultimate gaming insult, an “A for effort.”  I also found this amusing, because what game does that?!

If you want a silly, quirky game and you don’t mind learning odd controls, I would recommend this game. It’s just too unique to pass up.

Also, I wasn’t actually even going to play this game for a while (too many other ones to play), but almost every time I turn on Steam, there’s an update to some part of this game. Usually it’s only a few mb, but so many updates. I haven’t ever had a game that was so well-supported, and based on that level of customer service, I would buy this game again in a heartbeat. Thank you, caring developer! While I may not have the time to finish this little gem for a while, I notice and appreciate the effort!

I won’t give this a rating out of 10 because I’m extremely biased about my love for B-rank cult-classics; but I will say this, if you love that type of stuff too, I would definitely get this game. It’s a silly good time, and it seems like the developer really cares about it, even after all these years, and that means something (at least to me it does). If you want to support sci-fi silliness, love, and B-rank goodness, this is a good purchase. If you don’t like all of those things, just be warned that it’s not gonna be some open-world Star Wars game. If you don't mind the controls, you still might like it for the unique experience.

Outcast, un autre jeu d'action/aventure que trop souvent je refais en espérant toujours un jour une éventuelle suite. Quand j'ai donc entendu parlé du projet Kickstarter pour la réalisation d'un remake HD du jeu (dirigé par les créateurs du jeu en personne), j'ai donc sauté sur l'occasion et fait le plus de publicité possible à l'égard de ce projet et de cette série dont la qualité n'est plus à prouver. Hélas le projet fut un échec, mais cela donna des idées aux développeurs, comme sortir leur jeu sur Steam, pour financer le projet.

Nous avons donc là le retour d'Oucast dans une version qui pour le moment ressemble beaucoup à la version d'origine (avec plus de bugs peut-être). Mais ne soyez pas trop hatif dans vos jugements, le jeu se modernise rapidemment et cette version "1.1" devrait très rapidemment redonner toutes ses lettres de noblesses à ce jeu.

En tout cas elle ne retire en rien ce qui fait la force de ce titre, une liberté de déplacement totale, une aventure dans un monde magique et très vivant (une révolution à l'époque). Vos actions auront des conséquences sur vos interactions avec la populace et vos faciliterons ou non, votre mission.

Au niveau sonore, on profite d'une bande son incroyable et d'une VF juste parfaite pour l'époque. Graphiquement, est-il nécessaire de rappeler la prouesse technologique que représentait à l'époque ce jeu ? Certes maintenant on pourrait penser que le jeu à assez mal vieillis, mais ce choix est aussi ce qui fait la beauté et le charme artistique du jeu.


Au final encore, on attend surtout de voir les nouveautés et réelles optimisations que cette 1.1 devrait apporter. Et on espère surtout, qu'après toutes ces années, notre Outcast 2 revienne à nouveau sur les lèvres de tous.

13975203.review:
Après l'esquisse d'un remake HD dont la campagne Kickstarter n'aura malheureusement réussi qu'à séduire une poignée de fans déjà conquis, Fresh3D revient sur Steam avec une approche plus pragmatique : proposer le jeu original avec quelques améliorations, puis l'améliorer jusqu'à, éventuellement, atteindre le niveau visuel escompté pour ledit remake HD… si les ventes le permettent (bon, pour le moment, et sans vouloir être défaitiste, ça semble un peu mal barré).

Au menu ? Prise en charge des résolutions d'écran modernes, support du gamepad, nouvelle interface rapide de changement d'arme, sous-titres* et moteur de rendu multithreadé. Et franchement, rien que le fait de ne rien avoir à patcher, de ne pas avoir à sous-cadencer son processeur (pour éviter la panna de Twon-Ha) et de pouvoir lancer le jeu en résolution native, ça change tout.
Les plus nostalgiques retrouveront leur Shamazaar enchanteur, tandis que les nouveaux joueurs pourront goûter au premier et au meilleur mélange de TPS à monde ouvert et de jeu d'aventure, bardé de dialogues et de personnages, et gratiné d'une fine couche de petits détails qu'on aimerait tous revoir dans les jeux modernes. Vous savez, ces petits trucs qui ne donnent pas l'impression au joueur d'être pris pour un abruti, mais bien d'être aidé sans être assisté. Je pense notamment aux directions données par les Talans lorsqu'on leur demande s'ils ont vu telle ou telle personne, ou qui peuvent la pointer du doigt, ou qui peuvent refuser de colporter des ragots à son encontre si elle se trouve à côté d'eux...

Difficile de dire si l'équipe réussira à atteindre son objectif final, mais ils sont en tout cas très réactifs et dynamiques, et les quelques bugs majeurs qui subsistaient n'auront pas fait long feu, après huit patchs sortis en quatre jours en pleine période des fêtes. On ne peut pas en dire autant de Beamdog.
Et en plus de ça, ils en ont profité pour mettre à jour la version GOG, sans aucune contrepartie.

À ce prix, vous ne risquez pas grand chose.

13894986.review:
In my opinion this is still the best game ever made. Here is why.

It may be old but the game is still fun and exciting. It has a enganging and epic story.
Getting the talans to support you in your endeavour takes time but it really helps making Adelpha a believeable world.
Also you can actually ask your way around to find important NPCs, which I would like in many modern games instead of following a blimp on the map.

And if you play it, just wait until you get to the city of Okriana. Then stop for a moment and just catch the atmosphere of the city, which is one of the most convincing simulations of a living city. I have yet to find a modern game which does that, GTA has the dome in which the player moves and some people/cars that surround him and AC has the same crowds always treading the same paths, so these never felt convincing, although I like these games too.

Other fond memories include the regions of Okasankaar, which back then had the coolest water/ocean effects or the region of Okaar with its forest, where things were actually falling from trees. You could really see the effort and passion  the people who created this game have put into it to create a convincing and living world.

Also the game gets very good support by the devs.
You should definitely play it.

13891131.review:
Outcast is certainly worth a playthrough, even today. After 15 years, there have been little to no other games following its game concept of an open-world third-person shooter where you don't just shoot everyone (OWTPSWYDJSE in short), and the "stranger in a strange world" setting concept is almost extinct because consumers prefer things they know.
This game will throw you into a strange world and force you to adapt to being called the Ulukai, to everything and its mother being or having a "Fandazma", and to saving with a "Gaamsaav".
The gameplay is solid third-person shooting with the ability to switch to first person, but it is sadly hindered by its technical nature.
This is because it uses Voxels. These are basically 3D pixels that face in a certain direction, giving the illusion of a 3D world. Everything except small objects and characters is made out of Voxels. When you turn around, you'll notice "scan lines" going through the world - these adjust the Voxels into a new direction. Overall it looks really weird, but I don't know if it would look better or worse if the game had used polygon technology back then.
Point of the matter is that there is no such "adjusting mechanic" vertically. You'll notice that when you talk to an NPC in an elevated position - the ground behind you or them vanishes. To prevent that in normal gameplay, your camera has a very limited vertical range, even in first person, meaning you can't shoot enemies from, say a ledge. Extremely frustrating.
To make up for this, in third person your character will auto-aim vertically, but that's not too reliable and auto-aim sucks in general. If this was fixed, the gameplay would be absolutely solid third/first-person shooting, unless you have a fetish for chest-high walls and bloody screens.

Something else I noticed is that the voice quality seems to be low. I always thought Talan voices were modulated to sound more alien, but even the humans sound weird, which leads me to believe that they're in a low bitrate.
Luckily, this doesn't affect the soundtrack. Which is spectacular, by the way. For one of the first games to use orchestral music, Outcast's is simply phenomenal. Incredible achievement by Lennie Moore, I would have backed the kickstarter for his involvement if nothing else.

The 1.1 improvements are good enough. The original Outcast had a highly limited resolution range (below 640x480) which could be modified to run at 1280x720 with terrible performance. This release updated that to a max resolution of 1920x1080. This is still a limit to some, but the game seems to be running with DirectX 8 currently, which has a max resolution of 2048x1536 (everything above 1920x1080 leads to problems though). The performance is still relatively bad, but playable. The game's probably biggest curiosity is that it runs entirely on the CPU, which even today simply is not made for graphical calculations. The multi-core support and updated compiler helped, but even on an Haswell-E it only uses 20% per core, resulting in a framerate of somewhere between 20 and 90 FPS.
To be blunt, just like the Kickstarter, the 1.1 Update has a certain amateurish vibe to it. The launcher has minor graphical glitches (and comes standard with an annoying Twitter panel that shows all Tweets mentioning Outcast), the setting menu has the standard Windows Forms icon and the intro video is played in Windows Media Player, and is stretched from 4:3 to 16:9. Still - it does its job, and the ongoing updates are laudable.

Overall, I'd say that Outcast 1.1 is worth its money, and moreso because unlike with other old games the money actually goes to the developers. I have followed Outcast casually throughout the years and saw how the devs tried to get their hands on the IP over and over until they finally got it in 2013. If that isn't dedication, nothing is.

J’ai joué à ce jeu à sa sortie fin des années 90, jeu qui était doté d’un moteur graphique révolutionnaire à l’époque (les effets d’eau par exemple !). 
J’ai toujours la boite. Il fait partie des jeux cultes pour moi. (terme qu’on a tendance à un peu trop donner pour certains jeux)
Un excellent game play, de belles textures pour l’époque. Avec cette version disponible sur steam, on a droit à quelques améliorations graphiques, on peut jouer en « hd » si on veut. Mais je le joue en ce moment en 1024x768 sur un pc pentium 4 et sous xp : le jeu est très fluide, donc pas besoin de config de course, malgré ces patches graphiques, pour apprécier ce petit chef-d’œuvre.
Aventure, action, tps (tps à la base, on peut mettre en mode fps de temps en temps si on veut, et cela peut-être parfois utile pour certaines opérations). Des quêtes à résoudre, de vastes maps, des mondes ouverts, de l’immersion, une grande liberté d’action, un excellent scénario.
Donc, une très longue durée de vie, je suis à près de 20h, et je n’ai pas encore fini !
Une excellente version française, et pour le héros, la voix de Bruce Willis (enfin sa voix française pour nous les francophone !). De l’humour aussi.
Merci Steam, merci Fresh 3D.
Je me replonge avec délice dans ce jeu. A refaire ou à découvrir…
